title: single use plastic:Images Of Containers Made Of Banana Leaves Are Doing Rounds On Social Media, Hinting Towards Replacement Of Single Use Plastic

Replacing Plastic, One Leaf At A Time: People Are Now Using Eco-Friendly Containers Made Of Leaves

Replacing Plastic, One Leaf At A Time: People Are Now Using Eco-Friendly Containers Made Of Leaves

Waking up to the consequences of dumping plastic in the environment, small and large scale businesses in India are dumping the use of single use plastic. Small-scale changes are already being made. Plastic straws are being replaced by sturdy paper straws and even pasta straws in restaurants, and bamboo is coming out as a strong alternative for plastic.

Steps are even being taken on local levels to reduce the use of or completely replace plastic.

Twitter handle @Savi_IFS shared some pictures of banana leaves being used as bowls and containers for food. The images are going viral, however some comments on the tweet suggest that the images are originally from Thailand. However, each image could be from a different place, including India.

Good news. Plastic being replaced by traditional food packaging options dt r healthier & environment friendly.

Anyone could share contact number of their suppliers in North India?@Ahambhumika @ParveenKaswan pic.twitter.com/OMfuOw7dCB — Savii (@Savi_IFS) October 19, 2019

Nevertheless, a fair number of people came forward and provided their contacts, offering to be suppliers of such containers. One person tweeted a picture of using leaves to wrap food items with the caption, ‘We use it for our packaging and delivery through flight to ITC Hotel in Kolkata from Guwahati’.

We use it for our packaging and delivery through flight to ITC Hotel in Kolkata from Guwahati. Doable. pic.twitter.com/9fXW5sjP5p — Gunajit Brahma (@GunajitB) October 20, 2019

Don't Miss 12.9 K SHARES 415 SHARES 5.2 K SHARES 16.6 K SHARES

Only a few days ago, Kiren Rijiju shared a video from the North East, which showed a local vendor using leaves instead of single-use plastic polythene to wrap fish.

"PM @narendramodi has told us not to use plastics so we are using local leaves because plastics are no more available"

A local meat vendor at remote Tirbin, Lepa Rada Dist, Arunachal Pradesh. pic.twitter.com/Z1vuB2K8fK — Kiren Rijiju (@KirenRijiju) October 6, 2019

People who think that trees are cut for their leaves are wrong, because leaves are picked from trees in such a way that they eventually regenerate. So there is no loss to natural life.

Change is happening, even though it is slow, baby steps are going to lead us in the direction of a complete plastic ban.
